Package service

Interface ServiceSql

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractServiceSql, ServiceSqlImpl
public interface ServiceSql
Service interface for SQL dialect information and query validation.

Provides methods to retrieve the current SQL dialect, validate or analyze SQL queries, and perform simple syntax checks on SQL code.

Author:
Felix Seggeb√§ing

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    getDialect()
    Returns the name of the SQL dialect currently used.
    String
    getErrorsFor(String sql)
    Executes the given SQL query and collects and returns error messages if execution fails, therefore returns an empty string if execution is successful.
    default boolean
    isQuery(String sql)
    Checks whether the given string is a valid SQL SELECT query according to simple syntactic rules.

  • Method Details

    • getDialect

      String getDialect()
      Returns the name of the SQL dialect currently used.

      If the dialect cannot be determined, returns "UNKNOWN".

      Returns:
      the SQL dialect class name, or "UNKNOWN" if unavailable

    • getErrorsFor

      String getErrorsFor(String sql)
      Executes the given SQL query and collects and returns error messages if execution fails, therefore returns an empty string if execution is successful.

      If errors occur, returns all error messages concatenated as a single string (with each message on a separate line).

      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL query string to test
      Returns:
      a string containing error messages if execution fails, or an empty string if the query is valid

    • isQuery

      default boolean isQuery(String sql)
      Checks whether the given string is a valid SQL SELECT query according to simple syntactic rules.

      Returns true if the string is at least 8 characters long, starts with "select " or "select\n" (case-insensitive), and does not contain a semicolon.

      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL string to check
      Returns:
      true if the string qualifies as a valid SELECT query, false otherwise
